summary:
=== Purchase Information === Product Title: Manchild - The Complete First Season Review Date: 2005/10/05 Store: Will Adamsdale (Actor), Frances Barber (Actor), Audrey Cooke (Director), David Evans (II) (Director) & 1 more Rated: NR Format: DVD Categories: Movies & TV, BBC, All BBC Titles Average Rating: 4.5 Product Details: {'Aspect Ratio': '1.78:1', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Package Dimensions': '7.5 x 5.4 x 0.6 inches; 4.8 Ounces', 'Director': 'Audrey Cooke, David Evans (II)', 'Media Format': 'Closed-captioned, Color, DVD, Enhanced, Widescreen, NTSC', 'Run time': '3 hours and 16 minutes', 'Release date': 'August 10, 2004', 'Actors': 'Will Adamsdale, Frances Barber, Christine Kavanagh, Joel Want, Ben Want', 'Studio': 'BBC / Koch Vision', 'Number of discs': '2'} Review Text: I have to admit, I bought Manchild because I like Anthony Stewart Head and wanted to see more of him. (In the second season, I saw quite a bit more as he paraded around sans clothing!) After watching this show once, I watched it again...and again. At first, you think, man, these guys are beasts, then you realize that they are pretty insecure and have really failed at growing up but disguise this with tons of money. They are having a great time, but it's so superficial that even they occasionally notice. I know you aren't supposed to feel sorry for them, that they've made their beds etc., but really, you can't help it. They've exchanged all the stuff that makes life meaningful, their families and children, tossed it away for money and easy sex. Terry, the ringleader, more or less shows the others what direction to take, especially James (The Anthony Stewart Head character.) All he cares about is money and a parade of very young women in his bed. James, poor schlub, is probably an OK guy who is completely ruled by his sex drive. We find out that he cheated on his wife the night before they were married. His kids and now ex-wife hate him. Gary, still married to his first love, is ruled with an iron hand. He can only fantasize about the easy sex that the other men enjoy. Patrick, a loving son, has never married, but is apparantly just as cavalier with relationships as the other men. He's also quite strange.

If you watch this series expecting to like these guys, you're going to be disappointed. If you want to see some great acting and some truely appalling characters, this show is for you. Its incredibly funny, but not for everybody. I wouldn't let my kids watch it. Review Title: Funny and Sad! Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: The Best of Abbott & Costello, Vol. 3 (Abbott & Costello Go to Mars / Abbott & Costello in the Foreign Legion / Abbott & Costello Meet Frankenstein / Abbott & Costello Meet the Invisible Man / Abbott & Costello Meet the Killer / Comin' Round the Mountain / Lost in Alaska / Mexican Hayride) Review Date: 2007/08/11 Store: Bud Abbott (Actor), Lou Costello (Actor), Charles Barton (Director), Charles Lamont (Director) & 1 more Rated: NR Format: DVD Categories: Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Comedy Product Description: ["Includes the following movies, Abbott and Costello Meet Frankenstein Mexican Hayride Abbott and Costello Meet the Killer, Boris Karloff Abbott and Costello in the Foreign Legion Abbott and Costello Meet the Invisible Man Comin' Round the Mountain Lost in Alaska Abbott and Costello Go to Mars", 'NOTE:', 'There is a message on the title menu which states "flip the disc over to play the other two episodes."'] Average Rating: 4.8 Product Details: {'Genre': 'DVD Movie, Blu-ray Movie, Comedy', 'Format': 'Black & White, Closed-captioned, Dolby, Full Screen, NTSC', 'Contributor': 'Jean Yarbrough, John Grant, Charles Bradstreet, Robert Lees, Charles Lamont, Bud Abbott, Lon Chaney, Jr., Nancy Guild, Jane Randolph, Lou Costello, Frederic I. Rinaldo, Boris Karloff, Robert Arthur, Bela Lugosi, Glenn Strange, Lenore Aubert, Adele Jergens, William Frawley, Patricia Medina, Charles Barton, Frank Ferguson, Sheldon Leonard, Howard Christie, Dorothy ShayJean Yarbrough, John Grant, Charles Bradstreet, Robert Lees, Charles Lamont, Bud Abbott, Lon Chaney, Jr., Nancy Guild, Jane Randolph, Lou Costello, Frederic I. Rinaldo, Boris Karloff, Robert Arthur, Bela Lugosi, Glenn Strange, Lenore Aubert, Adele Jergens, William Frawley,… See more', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 2.0 Mono)', 'Runtime': '10 hours and 34 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.33:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.75 x 5.75 x 0.53 inches; 0.01 Ounces', 'Director': 'Charles Barton, Charles Lamont, Jean Yarbrough', 'Media Format': 'Black & White, Closed-captioned, Dolby, Full Screen, NTSC', 'Run time': '10 hours and 34 minutes', 'Release date': 'October 6, 2009', 'Actors': 'Bud Abbott, Lou Costello, Patricia Medina, Lon Chaney, Jr., Boris Karloff', 'Subtitles': 'English, Spanish, French', 'Producers': 'Howard Christie, Robert Arthur', 'Studio': 'Universal Pictures Home Entertainment', 'Writers': 'Robert Lees, Frederic I. Rinaldo, John Grant', 'Number of discs': '2'} Review Text: Two DVD's, 8 films. Picture and film quality is as good as technology can make something this old. The balance between the films is uneven, but I guess every movie can't be a gem. A little pricey for what you get, actually. I remember watching these movies as a kid and being absolutely thrilled with them. Abbott and Costello Meet Frankenstein and Abbott and Costello Meet the Killer will have you laughing in the aisles. The other movies have their moments, but don't expect more than an occasional chuckle. Review Title: Classic Rating: 4.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: Undercover Blues [DVD] Review Date: 2012/06/27 Store: Kathleen Turner (Actor), Dennis Quaid (Actor), Herbert Ross (Director) & 0 more Rated: PG-13 Format: DVD Categories: Movies & TV, MGM Home Entertainment, All MGM Titles Product Description: ['Product Description', 'Kathleen Turner and Dennis Quaid are "in top form [in] this winning comedy" (The Hollywood Reporter) about a couple of super spies persuaded out of maternity leave and into world-class espionage action! Co-starring Stanley Tucci, Park Overall and Tom Arnold, and set in atmospheric New Orleans, Undercover Blues is "guaranteed to leave you giddy and grateful" (The Houston Post)! Jeff and Jane Blue (Quaid and Turner) are the doting parents of a new baby girl. They also happen to be America\'s best chance at national security. Just as they embark on that perilous adventure known as parenting, they are asked to save the world from a treacherous arms embezzler. But are their martial-arts skills, cunning and high-tech know-how any match for a diabolic terrorist and aten-pound tyrant?', 'Amazon.com', 'When fun-loving American agents Dennis Quaid and Kathleen Turner are called back from maternity leave for a special assignment in New Orleans, the spy parents decide to skip the sitter and give their bouncing baby girl the adventure of a lifetime. There\'s nothing to the dumb story about a deadly arms dealer (Fiona Shaw) in the Louisiana Bayou, but you\'d be hard put to find a friskier pair of doting parents. Quaid is all dimpled grins and cocky cool and Turner is the most maternal martial arts mom you\'ve ever seen, but Stanley Tucci almost steals the film as the hot-blooded threat thug Morty ("That\x92s Muerte!"). His macho mission of vengeance becomes pure slapstick silliness punctuated by girlish squeals of alarm. Dumb? Sure, but the deft comic direction of Herbert Ross and bubbly chemistry of Quaid and Turner make', 'Undercover Blues', 'far more fun that it should be.', '--Sean Axmaker'] Average Rating: 4.8 Product Details: {'Genre': 'Comedy', 'Format': 'Anamorphic, Closed-captioned, Color, Dubbed, DVD, Full Screen, Subtitled, Widescreen, NTSC', 'Contributor': 'Larry Miller, Jan Triska, Kathleen Turner, Tom Arnold, Marshall Bell, Fiona Shaw, Dennis Quaid, Ian Abrams, Herbert Ross, Stanley Tucci, Obba Babatund, Richard Jenkins, Ralph Brown, Park OverallLarry Miller, Jan Triska, Kathleen Turner, Tom Arnold, Marshall Bell, Fiona Shaw, Dennis Quaid, Ian Abrams, Herbert Ross, Stanley Tucci, Obba Babatund, Richard Jenkins, Ralph Brown, Park Overall See more', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 2.0 Surround), Unqualified, Spanish (Dolby Digital 2.0 Mono)', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 30 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.85:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG-13 (Parents Strongly Cautioned)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.5 x 5.5 x 0.5 inches; 3.2 Ounces', 'Director': 'Herbert Ross', 'Media Format': 'Anamorphic, Closed-captioned, Color, Dubbed, DVD, Full Screen, Subtitled, Widescreen, NTSC', 'Run time': '1 hour and 30 minutes', 'Release date': 'April 1, 2003', 'Actors': 'Kathleen Turner, Dennis Quaid, Fiona Shaw, Stanley Tucci, Larry Miller', 'Dubbed': 'Spanish', 'Subtitles': 'English, Spanish, French', 'Studio': 'MGM (Video & DVD)', 'Writers': 'Ian Abrams', 'Number of discs': '1'} Review Text: I was really surprised and very pleased to go out to my mail box and find my movie waiting for me already. DVD and case were in good shape. I don't normally buy anything like CD's or DVD's during the summer because it gets so hot here, but even with an outdoor temp. of 110, the movie was fine. Review Title: Excellent service Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: The Thing from Another World Review Date: 2015/05/10 Store: James Arness (Actor), Margaret Sheridan (Actor), Christian Nyby (Director) & 0 more Rated: NR Format: DVD Categories: Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Horror Product Description: ['Thing from Another World, The (DVD)', "A UFO crashes near an isolated military base in the far Arctic.Scientists recover the craft's now-frozen alien pilot and take it back to their base. While debating whether to study the alien, try to communicate with it or kill it, the pilot awakens--and the scientists' question of if it is friend or foe is quickly answered.Now, trapped in a frozen wasteland with an unstoppable, nonhuman creature that sees them as prey, the small band of scientists come face to face with The Thing.", ']]>'] Average Rating: 4.8 Product Details: {'Genre': 'Horror, Fantasy, Science Fiction', 'Format': 'Full Screen, Closed-captioned, Black & White, NTSC, Subtitled', 'Contributor': 'William Self, Dewey Martin, Robert Cornthwaite, Eduard Franz, Douglas Spencer, Charles Lederer, Christian Nyby, James R. Young, Howard Hawks, Kenneth Tobey, Robert Nichols, Sally Creighton, Margaret Sheridan, John W. Campbell Jr., James ArnessWilliam Self, Dewey Martin, Robert Cornthwaite, Eduard Franz, Douglas Spencer, Charles Lederer, Christian Nyby, James R. Young, Howard Hawks, Kenneth Tobey, Robert Nichols, Sally Creighton, Margaret Sheridan, John W. Campbell Jr., James Arness See more', 'Initial release date': '2005-09-13', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 1.0), Unqualified', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.33:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 0.32 Ounces', 'Item model number': 'Relay Time: 81 min', 'Director': 'Christian Nyby', 'Media Format': 'Full Screen, Closed-captioned, Black & White, NTSC, Subtitled', 'Run time': '1 hour and 27 minutes', 'Release date': 'September 13, 2005', 'Actors': 'James Arness, Margaret Sheridan, Kenneth Tobey, Robert Cornthwaite, Douglas Spencer', 'Subtitles': 'English, French, Spanish', 'Producers': 'Howard Hawks', 'Studio': 'Studio Distribution Services', 'Writers': 'Charles Lederer', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'} Review Text: A classic film full of smart-alecky dialog coupled with absolute terror when they realize that the Thing is loose. Unlike the more modern versions, there is nothing sickening or gory here, but it's a very clever film. Somewhere, years ago, I read a comparison of the 2008 version and this one. They mentioned that in the older film, it reflected the Cold War mentality--the enemy is out there, trying to get in, and in the modern adaptation, the enemy is already inside and is hiding amongst us. I thought it was an interesting point to make, but I just like the movie. It's a family favorite that I grew up watching and all my brothers and sisters quote dialog from it at the drop of a hat. Review Title: Great Film made when they still understood scary doesn't have to mean gore Rating: 5.0 --------------------------------------------------

The other movies have their moments, but don't expect more than an occasional chuckle. Co-starring Stanley Tucci, Park Overall and Tom Arnold, and set in atmospheric New Orleans, Undercover Blues is "guaranteed to leave you giddy and grateful" (The Houston Post)! Jeff and Jane Blue (Quaid and Turner) are the doting parents of a new baby girl. They also happen to be America\'s best chance at national security. Just as they embark on that perilous adventure known as parenting, they are asked to save the world from a treacherous arms embezzler. But are their martial-arts skills, cunning and high-tech know-how any match for a diabolic terrorist and aten-pound tyrant?', 'Amazon.com', 'When fun-loving American agents Dennis Quaid and Kathleen Turner are called back from maternity leave for a special assignment in New Orleans, the spy parents decide to skip the sitter and give their bouncing baby girl the adventure of a lifetime. There\'s nothing to the dumb story about a deadly arms dealer (Fiona Shaw) in the Louisiana Bayou, but you\'d be hard put to find a friskier pair of doting parents. Quaid is all dimpled grins and cocky cool and Turner is the most maternal martial arts mom you\'ve ever seen, but Stanley Tucci almost steals the film as the hot-blooded threat thug Morty ("That\x92s Muerte!"). His macho mission of vengeance becomes pure slapstick silliness punctuated by girlish squeals of alarm. Dumb? Sure, but the deft comic direction of Herbert Ross and bubbly chemistry of Quaid and Turner make', 'Undercover Blues', 'far more fun that it should be.', '--Sean Axmaker'] Average Rating: 4.8 Product Details: {'Genre': 'Comedy', 'Format': 'Anamorphic, Closed-captioned, Color, Dubbed, DVD, Full Screen, Subtitled, Widescreen, NTSC', 'Contributor': 'Larry Miller, Jan Triska, Kathleen Turner, Tom Arnold, Marshall Bell, Fiona Shaw, Dennis Quaid, Ian Abrams, Herbert Ross, Stanley Tucci, Obba Babatund, Richard Jenkins, Ralph Brown, Park OverallLarry Miller, Jan Triska, Kathleen Turner, Tom Arnold, Marshall Bell, Fiona Shaw, Dennis Quaid, Ian Abrams, Herbert Ross, Stanley Tucci, Obba Babatund, Richard Jenkins, Ralph Brown, Park Overall See more', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 2.0 Surround), Unqualified, Spanish (Dolby Digital 2.0 Mono)', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 30 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.85:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG-13 (Parents Strongly Cautioned)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.5 x 5.5 x 0.5 inches; 3.2 Ounces', 'Director': 'Herbert Ross', 'Media Format': 'Anamorphic, Closed-captioned, Color, Dubbed, DVD, Full Screen, Subtitled, Widescreen, NTSC', 'Run time': '1 hour and 30 minutes', 'Release date': 'April 1, 2003', 'Actors': 'Kathleen Turner, Dennis Quaid, Fiona Shaw, Stanley Tucci, Larry Miller', 'Dubbed': 'Spanish', 'Subtitles': 'English, Spanish, French', 'Studio': 'MGM (Video & DVD)', 'Writers': 'Ian Abrams', 'Number of discs': '1'} Review Text: I was really surprised and very pleased to go out to my mail box and find my movie waiting for me already. DVD and case were in good shape. I don't normally buy anything like CD's or DVD's during the summer because it gets so hot here, but even with an outdoor temp. of 110, the movie was fine. Review Title: Excellent service Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: The Thing from Another World Review Date: 2015/05/10 Store: James Arness (Actor), Margaret Sheridan (Actor), Christian Nyby (Director) & 0 more Rated: NR Format: DVD Categories: Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Horror Product Description: ['Thing from Another World, The (DVD)', "A UFO crashes near an isolated military base in the far Arctic.Scientists recover the craft's now-frozen alien pilot and take it back to their base. While debating whether to study the alien, try to communicate with it or kill it, the pilot awakens--and the scientists' question of if it is friend or foe is quickly answered.Now, trapped in a frozen wasteland with an unstoppable, nonhuman creature that sees them as prey, the small band of scientists come face to face with The Thing.", ']]>'] Average Rating: 4.8 Product Details: {'Genre': 'Horror, Fantasy, Science Fiction', 'Format': 'Full Screen, Closed-captioned, Black & White, NTSC, Subtitled', 'Contributor': 'William Self, Dewey Martin, Robert Cornthwaite, Eduard Franz, Douglas Spencer, Charles Lederer, Christian Nyby, James R. Young, Howard Hawks, Kenneth Tobey, Robert Nichols, Sally Creighton, Margaret Sheridan, John W. Campbell Jr., James ArnessWilliam Self, Dewey Martin, Robert Cornthwaite, Eduard Franz, Douglas Spencer, Charles Lederer, Christian Nyby, James R. Young, Howard Hawks, Kenneth Tobey, Robert Nichols, Sally Creighton, Margaret Sheridan, John W. Campbell Jr., James Arness See more', 'Initial release date': '2005-09-13', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 1.0), Unqualified', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.33:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 0.32 Ounces', 'Item model number': 'Relay Time: 81 min', 'Director': 'Christian Nyby', 'Media Format': 'Full Screen, Closed-captioned, Black & White, NTSC, Subtitled', 'Run time': '1 hour and 27 minutes', 'Release date': 'September 13, 2005', 'Actors': 'James Arness, Margaret Sheridan, Kenneth Tobey, Robert Cornthwaite, Douglas Spencer', 'Subtitles': 'English, French, Spanish', 'Producers': 'Howard Hawks', 'Studio': 'Studio Distribution Services', 'Writers': 'Charles Lederer', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'} Review Text: A classic film full of smart-alecky dialog coupled with absolute terror when they realize that the Thing is loose. Unlike the more modern versions, there is nothing sickening or gory here, but it's a very clever film. Somewhere, years ago, I read a comparison of the 2008 version and this one. They mentioned that in the older film, it reflected the Cold War mentality--the enemy is out there, trying to get in, and in the modern adaptation, the enemy is already inside and is hiding amongst us. I thought it was an interesting point to make, but I just like the movie. It's a family favorite that I grew up watching and all my brothers and sisters quote dialog from it at the drop of a hat. Review Title: Great Film made when they still understood scary doesn't have to mean gore Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- Structure your response as: SUMMARY: [Final synthesis of preferences and patterns]
raw_response:
SUMMARY:
The purchase history reveals a strong preference for nostalgic entertainment, particularly classic movies and TV series, with notable enjoyment in comedy and drama genres. The individual's consistent high ratings, often between 4.5 and 5.0, indicate a tendency to favor engaging storytelling and character-driven narratives. Themes of humor and satire are prevalent, suggesting an appreciation for clever writing and comedic performances, especially in iconic duos like Abbott and Costello.

Quality appears to be a significant factor in decision-making, as evidenced by high ratings for well-regarded films regardless of their age or format. The willingness to purchase DVDs implies a collector's mindset, valuing physical media over digital streaming. Price sensitivity is evident, with one reviewer mentioning that a product felt "a little pricey for what you get," indicating a critical evaluation of value.

Moreover, the reviews hint at a disposition towards critical thinking, as the buyer reflects on character complexity and hidden themes, suggesting deeper engagement with the material beyond surface enjoyment. Overall, the core preferences center around classic comedic and dramatic content, high-quality production, and a critical appreciation for character development and storytelling.

target_interaction.title: OK, but not as good as the 1951 version
target_interaction.text: The other versions were better.  My main complaint here was too many beardy guys that served no other purpose but to explode and startle you.  The old black and white version from the 50's told a better story and better conveyed the fear and atmosphere of the idea.  In this version, there was no way anybody could have realistically got away from this thing.  If a single cell could infect somebody, all the monster needed to do was spit in the soup.  There were good points, but overall--it's been done better elsewhere.
description: It’s not human. Yet. From the producers of Dawn of the Dead comes the chilling prelude to John Carpenter’s cult classic film. When paleontologist Kate Lloyd (Mary Elizabeth Winstead) travels to an isolated outpost in Antarctica for the expedition of a lifetime, she joins an international team that unearths a remarkable discovery. Their elation quickly turns to fear as they realize that their experiment has freed a mysterious being from its frozen prison. Paranoia spreads like an epidemic as a creature that can mimic anything it touches will pit human against human as it tries to survive and flourish in this spine-tingling thriller.
